intro: Dimorphanthus japonicus, commonly known as the Japanese dimorphanthus, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive two-lobed leaves. The plant produces showy, pink or purple flowers that bloom in summer. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens. Dimorphanthus japonicus prefers well-drained soil and partial shade to full sun.
